document.masterDocTitle: Description of a new species of Odontofroggatia (Chalcidoidea, Epichrysomallinae) associated with Ficus microcarpa (Moraceae) with a key to species of the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of a new species of Odontofroggatia (Chalcidoidea, Epichrysomallinae) associated with Ficus microcarpa (Moraceae) with a key to species of the genus

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Odontofroggatia Ishii

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Antennal formula 11053 (
Figs 1
A, 3 a) .......................................................
O. quinifuniculus Feng & Huang
sp. nov.

3 Mandible tridentate (
Fig. 1
A), propodeum with ridges medially (
Figs 1
B, F)............................................................ 4

- Mandible bidentate (
Wiebes 1980 , fig. 8
), propodeum without ridges (
Figs 1
J, N) .................................................... 5

4 Propodeum with two distinct sub-median longitudinal ridges in posterior two-thirds connected to two curved ridges in anterior third that form more or less W-like pattern (
Fig. 1
F;
Wiebes 1980
, pl. I, fig. 3 ); funicle with all segments having plate sensilla (
Fig. 1
E) ..............................................................................................................
O. ishii Wiebes

5 Funicular segments tightly connected, and each segment with a row of longitudinal plate sensilla extending only slightly beyond distal margin; toruli separated by distance subequal to torulus diameter (
Fig. 1
M)
O. corneri Wiebes

- Funicular segments loosely arranged, each segment with strong longitudinal plate sensilla extending beyond distal margin by about half length of funicular segment; toruli separated by distance approximately equal to one-third torulus diameter (
Fig.
1
I)
............................................................................................................................ O. galili
Wiebes

7 Mandibles short, labial palpi present, antennal toruli separated from clypeal margin by distance subequal to torulus diameter (
Fig. 1
G)
................................................................................................................................. O. ishii
Wiebes

8 Maxillary palpus about twice as long as wide; malar space about one-third as long as eye (
Fig. 1
C) ..........................
...................................................................................................................... O. quinifuniculus
Feng & Huang
sp. nov.

- Maxillary palpus slightly longer than wide; malar space about half as long as eye..........................
O. gajimaru Ishii

9 Hind coxa with dorsal teeth, petiole slightly longer than wide, unarmed (
Fig. 1
L;
Wiebes 1980
, fig. 1 ); toruli separated by distance about equal to half torulus diameter (
Fig. 1
K); clypeal margin with two slightly protruding lobes (
Fig. 1
K;
Bouček 1988
, fig. 238 ) .........................................................................................................
O. galili Wiebes

- Hind coxa unarmed; petiole approximately two times as long as wide, with a strong acute ventral hook (
Fig. 1
P;
Wiebes 1980
, fig. 6 ); toruli separated by distance equal to torulus diameter (
Fig. 1
O); clypeal margin emarginate (
Fig. 1
O;
Bouček 1988
, fig. 243 ) .....................................................................................................
O. corneri Wiebes
